Module to convert between ML_Core/Types Field layouts (i.e. NumericField and DiscreteField) and PBblas matrix layout (i.e. Layout_Cell)

Documentation.field: wi_id Work Item Number -- An identifier from 1 to 64K-1 that separates and identifies individual matrixes
x 1-based row position within the matrix
y 1-based column position within the matrix
v Real value for the cell
Documentation.see: Std/PBblas/Converted.ecl WARNING: Used as C++ attribute. Do not change without corresponding changes to MakeR8Set.
Documentation.content: Layout for Matrix Cell Main representation of Matrix cell at interface to all PBBlas functions. Matrixes are represented as DATASET(Layout_Cell), where each cell describes the row and column position of the cell as well as its value. Only the non-zero cells need to be contained in the dataset in order to describe the matrix since all unspecified cells are considered to have a value of zero. The cell also contains a work-item number that allows multiple separate matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface that allows the same operations to be performed on many different sets of data at once. Note that these matrixes do not have an explicit size. They are sized implicitly, based on the maximum row and column presented in the data. A matrix can be converted to an explicit dense form (see matrix_t) by using the utility module MakeR8Set. This module should only be used for known small matrixes (< 1M cells) or for partitions of a larger matrix. The Converted module provides utility functions to convert to and from a set of partitions (See Layout_parts).
Test for PBblas.Converted module. Convert to and from ML_Core/Types Field formats and Layout_Cell

Documentation.param: mat Matrix in DATASET(Layout_Cell) format

Documentation.content: Layout for Matrix Cell Main representation of Matrix cell at interface to all PBBlas functions. Matrixes are represented as DATASET(Layout_Cell), where each cell describes the row and column position of the cell as well as its value. Only the non-zero cells need to be contained in the dataset in order to describe the matrix since all unspecified cells are considered to have a value of zero. The cell also contains a work-item number that allows multiple separate matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface that allows the same operations to be performed on many different sets of data at once. Note that these matrixes do not have an explicit size. They are sized implicitly, based on the maximum row and column presented in the data. A matrix can be converted to an explicit dense form (see matrix_t) by using the utility module MakeR8Set. Documentation.field: wi_id Work Item Number -- An identifier from 1 to 64K-1 that separates and identifies individual matrixes

m_label A user provided label indicating to which matrix the dimensions apply, when used to describe a set of related matrixes (e.g., 'A', 'B', and 'C') for the same work item used in an operation. * @field partition_id A unique ID for this partition within the matrix
partition_id The 1-based id of this partition, unique within a work-item
node_id The node on which this partition is stored
m_rows The number of rows in the full matrix
m_cols The number of columns in the full matrix
row_blocks The number of row partitions in use
col_blocks The number of column partitions in use
block_row The row of this partition within the block partition matrix
block_col The column of this partition "
part_rows The number of rows stored within this partition
part_cols The number of columns stored within this partition
first_row The first row of the original matrix stored within this partition
first_col The first column of the original matrix stored within this partition
mat_part The dense representation of the cells values within this partition (see matrix_t)
Documentation.content: Alternate form for storage of large matrixes as a set of partitions Each partition holds the dense form of a piece of the matrix (see matrix_t) as well as information about its relationship to the larger matrix. The full matrix is then carried as DATASET(Layout_Part). Utility module Converted provides functions for converting a matrix in cell form (see Layout_cell) to partitions and vice versa. This form is primarily used internally to PBblas functions, but can also be used as an intermediate form to avoid repeated conversions from cell form. A work-item id field allows multiple matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface whereby the same operation can be performed on multiple sets of matrixes at once. The m_label field allows for the separation of multiple matrixes with the same wi_id for operations requiring multiple matrixes. This allows multiple work-items with multiple matrixes each to be carried in the same dataset.
Types for the Parallel Block Basic Linear Algebra Sub-programs support WARNING: attributes marked with WARNING can not be changed without making corresponding changes to the C++ attributes.
Type for partition id -- only supports up to 64K partitions
Type for node id -- only supports up to 64K nodes
Type for matrix cell values WARNING: type used in C++ attribute
Type for matrix label. Used for Matrix dimensions (see Layout_Dims) and for partitions (see Layout_Part)

Type for dense matrix storage Stored as a set of values in column/row order: [r1c1, r2c1, ... rMc1, r1c2, r2c2, ... rMc2, . . . r1cN, r2cN, ... rMcN] WARNING: type used in C++ attribute Note: This type is not distributed, so should only be used to represent small matrixes(< 1M cells). Larger matrixes can be represented using Layout_Cell or Layout_Part, both of which can be distributed. A dense matrix can be converted to a scalable sparse form (DATASET(Layout_Cell)) using the utility module FromR8Set
Enumeration for Partitioning Type
Translation of PartitionType enumeration
Type for matrix universe number Allow up to 64k matrices in one universe

Documentation.content: Alternate form for storage of large matrixes as a set of partitions Each partition holds the dense form of a piece of the matrix (see matrix_t) as well as information about its relationship to the larger matrix. The full matrix is then carried as DATASET(Layout_Part). Utility module Converted provides functions for converting a matrix in cell form (see Layout_cell) to partitions and vice versa. This form is primarily used internally to PBblas functions, but can also be used as an intermediate form to avoid repeated conversions from cell form. A work-item id field allows multiple matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface whereby the same operation can be performed on multiple sets of matrixes at once. The m_label field allows for the separation of multiple matrixes with the same wi_id for operations requiring multiple matrixes. This allows multiple work-items with multiple matrixes each to be carried in the same dataset.

Documentation.field: t_part_id The output partition to which this partition is related
t_node_id The node on which the output partition is located
t_block_row The row of the output partition within its partition matrix
t_block_col The column of the output partition within its partition matrix
t_term A row/column number used to correlate related input partitions used in calculating the results of the output partition
Documentation.content: Represents the relationship of a partition to the partition holding the results of a matrix operation. This is used internally to PBblas functions to tie an input partition to its output. It is not relevant to users of PBblas.

Documentation.field: m_label A user provided label indicating to which matrix the dimensions apply, when used to describe a set of related matrixes (e.g., 'A', 'B', and 'C') for the same work item used in an operation.
m_rows The number of rows in the full matrix
m_cols The number of colums in the full matrix
block_rows The number of rows in each partition of the matrix
block_cols The number of columns in each partition
row_blocks The number of row partitions in use for the matrix
col_blocks The number of column partitions in use for the matrix
Documentation.content: Record format for matrix and matrix partition dimensions. Each record describes A single matrix or matrix partition. Partitions use all of the fields, while a non-partitioned matrix only uses the first two (i.e. m_rows and m_cols).

Documentation.field: wi_id The wi_id, typically from a myriad set of matrixes
Documentation.content: Record for a list of work-item ids used internally

Module: Converted Utility module to convert matrixes between Cell-based form and Partition-based form Cell based matrixes provide a (potentially) sparse form organized as DATASET(Layout_Cell). Partition based matrixes are organized as a set of partitions (DATASET(Layout_Part)), with each partition holding a part of the matrix (in dense form). Both forms allow the matrix to be distributed among nodes so that it can be larger than the memory on any one node. This module provides a FromCells method as well as a FromParts method.

Documentation.field: wi_id Work Item Number -- An identifier from 1 to 64K-1 that separates and identifies individual matrixes

m_label A user provided label indicating to which matrix the dimensions apply, when used to describe a set of related matrixes (e.g., 'A', 'B', and 'C') for the same work item used in an operation. * @field partition_id A unique ID for this partition within the matrix
partition_id The 1-based id of this partition, unique within a work-item
node_id The node on which this partition is stored
m_rows The number of rows in the full matrix
m_cols The number of columns in the full matrix
row_blocks The number of row partitions in use
col_blocks The number of column partitions in use
block_row The row of this partition within the block partition matrix
block_col The column of this partition "
part_rows The number of rows stored within this partition
part_cols The number of columns stored within this partition
first_row The first row of the original matrix stored within this partition
first_col The first column of the original matrix stored within this partition
mat_part The dense representation of the cells values within this partition (see matrix_t)
Documentation.content: Alternate form for storage of large matrixes as a set of partitions Each partition holds the dense form of a piece of the matrix (see matrix_t) as well as information about its relationship to the larger matrix. The full matrix is then carried as DATASET(Layout_Part). Utility module Converted provides functions for converting a matrix in cell form (see Layout_cell) to partitions and vice versa. This form is primarily used internally to PBblas functions, but can also be used as an intermediate form to avoid repeated conversions from cell form. A work-item id field allows multiple matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface whereby the same operation can be performed on multiple sets of matrixes at once. The m_label field allows for the separation of multiple matrixes with the same wi_id for operations requiring multiple matrixes. This allows multiple work-items with multiple matrixes each to be carried in the same dataset.

Documentation.content: Layout for Matrix Cell Main representation of Matrix cell at interface to all PBBlas functions. Matrixes are represented as DATASET(Layout_Cell), where each cell describes the row and column position of the cell as well as its value. Only the non-zero cells need to be contained in the dataset in order to describe the matrix since all unspecified cells are considered to have a value of zero. The cell also contains a work-item number that allows multiple separate matrixes to be carried in the same dataset. This supports the "myriad" style interface that allows the same operations to be performed on many different sets of data at once. Note that these matrixes do not have an explicit size. They are sized implicitly, based on the maximum row and column presented in the data. A matrix can be converted to an explicit dense form (see matrix_t) by using the utility module MakeR8Set. This module should only be used for known small matrixes (< 1M cells) or for partitions of a larger matrix. The Converted module provides utility functions to convert to and from a set of partitions (See Layout_parts).

Documentation.field: m_label A user provided label indicating to which matrix the dimensions apply, when used to describe a set of related matrixes (e.g., 'A', 'B', and 'C') for the same work item used in an operation.
m_rows The number of rows in the full matrix
m_cols The number of colums in the full matrix
block_rows The number of rows in each partition of the matrix
block_cols The number of columns in each partition
row_blocks The number of row partitions in use for the matrix
col_blocks The number of column partitions in use for the matrix
Documentation.content: Record format for matrix and matrix partition dimensions. Each record describes A single matrix or matrix partition. Partitions use all of the fields, while a non-partitioned matrix only uses the first two (i.e. m_rows and m_cols).

Documentation.return: DATASET(Layout_Part) -- A dataset of partitions describing the same matrix(es) as the input cells.
Documentation.param: dims A DATASET(Layout_Dims) of partitioned dimensions
cells A DATASET(Layout_Cell) containing the cells of the matrix
Documentation.content: Convert a matrix in cell-based form (i.e. DATASET(Layout_Cell)) to a partition-based form (i.e. DATASET(Layout_Part). Partition sizes will be automatically determined. See PBblas/Internal/MatDims. Note that the cell-based form may be sparse (i.e. contains only non-zero cells). The resulting partition-based matrix will contain zero in any cell not specified. Partitions will no non-zero cells will be omitted. This module supports the "myriad" style interface in that both dimension and matrix parameters may describe many separate matrices with different work item ids.

Convert a matrix in Partition-based form (i.e. DATASET(Layout_Part)) to Cell-based form (i.e. DATASET(Layout_Cell)). Note that the returned cell-based matrix is sparse, in that it will only contain rows for cells that were non-zero in the original matrix. This interface supports "myriad" style, in that the partitions may represent many independent matrixes separated by different work item ids.
Documentation.param: parts_recs A DATASET(Layout_Parts) specifying the matrix(es) to be converted
transpose BOOLEAN parameter causes each matrix to be transposed during conversion

Take a dataset of cells (or sub-matrix thereof) and pack into a dense matrix. in column major order [r1c1, r2c1, r3c1, ..., rNc1, r1c2, ..., rNcM]. First row and first column are one based.
Documentation.return: Dense matrix or sub-matrix (SET OF REAL8)
Documentation.param: r The number of rows in the matrix or sub-matrix
s The number of columns in the matrix or sub-matrix
first_row The first row to include in the submatrix
first_col The first column to include in the submatrix
D The matrix to convert in Layout_Cell form
transpose Boolean to transpose the matrix during conversion (optional)

Documentation.param: v Input value
r Row number (1 based)
c Column number (1 based)
Documentation.content: Function prototype for a function to apply to each element of the distributed matrix Base your function on this prototype:

Documentation.return: A matrix (or multiple matrices) in Layout_Cell form

f A function based on the IElementFunc prototype
Documentation.content: Apply a function to each element of the matrix Use PBblas.IElementFunc as the prototype function. Input and ouput may be a single matrix, or myriad matrixes with different work item ids.
Function prototype for Apply2Cell.
Documentation.param: v the value
r the row ordinal
c the column ordinal

Documentation.content: Iterate matrix and apply function to each cell
Documentation.param: m number of rows
n number of columns
x matrix
f function to apply

Documentation.content: Absolute sum, the 1 norm of a vector.
Documentation.return: the sum of the absolute values
Documentation.param: m the number of entries
x the column major matrix holding the vector
incx the increment for x, 1 in the case of an actual vector
skipped default is zero, the number of entries stepped over to get to the first entry

Documentation.content: alpha*X + Y
Documentation.param: N number of elements in vector
alpha the scalar multiplier
X the column major matrix holding the vector X
incX the increment or stride for the vector
Y the column major matrix holding the vector Y
incY the increment or stride of Y
x_skipped number of entries skipped to get to the first X
y_skipped number of entries skipped to get to the first Y

Documentation.content: alpha*op(A) op(B) + beta*C where op() is transpose
Documentation.param: transposeA true when transpose of A is used
transposeB true when transpose of B is used
M number of rows in product
N number of columns in product
K number of columns/rows for the multiplier/multiplicand
alpha scalar used on A
A matrix A
B matrix B
beta scalar for matrix C
C matrix C or empty

Documentation.content: Compute LU Factorization of matrix A.
Documentation.return: composite matrix of factors, lower triangle has an implied diagonal of ones. Upper triangle has the diagonal of the composite.
Documentation.param: m number of rows of A
n number of columns of A

Documentation.content: DPOTF2 computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A. The factorization has the form A = U**T * U , if UPLO = 'U', or A = L * L**T, if UPLO = 'L', where U is an upper triangular matrix and L is lower triangular. This is the unblocked version of the algorithm, calling Level 2 BLAS.
Documentation.param: tri indicate whether upper or lower triangle is used
r number of rows/columns in the square matrix
A the square matrix
clear clears the unused triangle

Documentation.content: Scale a vector alpha
Documentation.param: N number of elements in the vector
alpha the scaling factor
X the column major matrix holding the vector
incX the stride to get to the next element in the vector
skipped the number of elements skipped to get to the first element

Documentation.content: Implements symmetric rank update C <- alpha A**T A + beta C or c <- alpha A A**T + beta C. C is N x N.
Documentation.param: tri update upper or lower triangle
transposeA Transpose the A matrix to be NxK
N number of rows
K number of columns in the update matrix or transpose
alpha the alpha scalar
A the update matrix, either NxK or KxN
beta the beta scalar
C the matrix to update
clear clear the triangle that is not updated. BLAS assumes that symmetric matrices have only one of the triangles and this option lets you make that true.

Documentation.content: Triangular matrix solver. op(A) X = alpha B or X op(A) = alpha B where op is Transpose, X and B is MxN
Documentation.return: the matrix of coefficients to get B.
Documentation.param: side side for A, Side.Ax is op(A) X = alpha B
tri Says whether A is Upper or Lower triangle
transposeA is op(A) the transpose of A
diag is the diagonal an implied unit diagonal or supplied
M number of rows
N number of columns
lda the leading dimension of the A matrix, either M or N
alpha the scalar multiplier for B
A a triangular matrix
B the matrix of values for the solve

Documentation.content: Extract the diagonal of he matrix
Documentation.param: m number of rows
n number of columns
x matrix from which to extract the diagonal

Documentation.content: Extract the upper or lower triangle. Diagonal can be actual or implied unit diagonal.
Documentation.param: m number of rows
n number of columns
tri Upper or Lower specifier, Triangle.Lower or Triangle.Upper
dt Use Diagonal.NotUnitTri or Diagonal.UnitTri
a Matrix, usually a composite from factoring

Documentation.content: Generate a diagonal matrix.
Documentation.param: m number of diagonal entries
v option value, defaults to 1
X optional input of diagonal values, multiplied by v.

Documentation.content: Make a vector of dimension m
Documentation.param: m number of elements
v the values, defaults to 1

Documentation.content: The trace of the input matrix
Documentation.return: the trace (sum of the diagonal entries)
Documentation.param: m number of rows
n number of columns
x the matrix
v Input value
r Row number (1 based)
c Column number (1 based)
Documentation.content: Function prototype for a function to apply to each element of the distributed matrix Base your function on this prototype:
